longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for Holders of a  Dual Nationality Card 
issued by Ghana. 
Visa Issuance:
- Dual nationals of Ghana not holding a  Dual Nationality
  Card  
- Holders of normal passports can obtain a pre-arranged visa
  on arrival, provided  
- Holders of an Emergency Visa on arrival Letter issued by
  Ghana Immigrations Service can obtain a visa on arrival,
  provided an approval has been obtained from the Immigration
  authorities at Accra (ACC) and an  OK TO BOARD  message is
  inserted in passenger`s reservation.
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold documents required for their
  next destination.
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry. 
 - Exempt are those traveling with/or to join diplomats
   accredited to Ghana:
   -holding diplomatic passports, or
   -holding (Gratis) visas
vaccination:
Passengers arriving without a yellow fever vaccination
certificate are subject to vaccination upon arrival:
- for nationals of Australia. Fee: GHS 20.-. 

Warning:
- Passengers leaving Ghana are required to present a yellow
  fever vaccination certificate upon departure.
Recommended:
- Vaccination against yellow fever for all passengers.
  Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists throughout the year in the whole country.
  Recommended prevention: C.
